title: External validation failed
content:
When an LDAP user requests an offering, the External validation failed error occurs. The following error message is displayed:

[WorkflowExecutionLogic.invokeValidationTemplate]: Failed to validate template [externalValidation] with parameters [{}]. Message is : External validation is failed.

Cause

This issue is caused due to the external validation timeout. The default external validation timeout interval is 10 seconds.

Solution

Follow these steps to enlarge the external validation timeout interval. The following example sets the interval to 20 seconds:

  1. In Postman, send a POST request with the following settings:
    • URL: https://<host>:<port>/auth/authentication-endpoint/authenticate/token?TENANTID=<tenant-id>
    • Select format as JSON and add the user name and password under the Body tab.
      Here is an example:
      {"login":"demoUser@example.com","password":"Password1"}
    • Note: Be sure to use the user name of tenant admin in the Body.
  2. Click Send, you will find that your request now received the authentication token under the response body.
  3. Next, send a PUT request in Postman with the following settings:
    • URL: https://<host>:<port>/rest/<tenant-id>/common-settings/setting/ESS_BACKUP_INTEGER2
    • Headers:
      • Add a Cookie header and set the value as SMAX_AUTH_TOKEN=%token%
      • Be sure to replace %token% with the authentication token you received in step 2.
      • Add a Content-Type header and set the value as application/json.
    • Body: {"value": "20"}   //set the timeout interval to 20 seconds
  4. Click Send.
